page.title: 05NORTH RONALDSAY'S CREELING
page.content: Fishin' for shellfish is cherried oot roond the island.The fishin' season ooswally starts in late Maey or early Chune and depenun on the wather conditions can last up tae late December.Approximately a hunder creels are worked by each o' the twa lobster bauts.The fishin',during the summar saeson,is mainly cherried oot on the Nort' side o' the island.This area extends fae the efters o' Linnay tae Dennis Taing.Taewards the end o' September the creels are shifted tae the East side,which covers fae Dennis Taing tae the point o' Twingness includun' the Reef dyke.Baith bauts hais twa o' a creel and baith men hais his ain colour o' bouyheid.The creels are set singly and ooswally haive aboot twunty o' close corked rope.It taks fae 5_6 hours tae complete the days wae the best creeling.
